job_posting.title: Product Engineer Co-op (6-month)
job_posting.description:
Why this role
Levo helps healthcare providers recruit and retain frontline talent — nurses, caregivers, clinicians, and others on the front lines of patient care. We're looking for a Product Engineer Co-op who thrives at the intersection of product and engineering.

This 6-month role is ideal for a Northeastern senior who wants to experience real ownership inside a fast-moving startup. You'll sit in on customer calls, use AI to accelerate how we ship code, and own features end-to-end — from mock-up to monitoring in production.

You'll work directly with the CEO and senior engineers, helping build tools used by some of the largest healthcare providers in the country.

What You'll Own

Product + Engineering Execution
* End-to-end ownership: mock-up, build, ship, and monitor features.
* Use AI tools daily (Copilot, Devin, etc.) to speed up development and ensure quality.
* Write tests and manage CI/CD for your own work.
* Join customer calls and implementations to integrate feedback directly.

Customer-Centered Development
* Translate customer asks into product requirements and user stories.
* Actively participate in customer implementations; understand workflows firsthand.
* Ship features that are reliable and usable in real healthcare environments.

Collaboration & Growth
* Work closely with Jason (CEO), Mikey, and Lily in Boston.
* Contribute ideas to product direction and development priorities.
* Propose and lead small workflow/process improvements to help the team ship faster.

15/30/45/90/120/180 Day Expectations

At 15 Days
* Get up to speed on Levo's stack (React, TypeScript, Go).
* Ship small but meaningful fixes/features (1–2 days speed-to-first-PR).
* Shadow customer calls and implementations.

At 30 Days
* Own and ship your first feature end-to-end (mock-up → build → ship → monitor).
* Balance speed of delivery with production reliability.

At 45–90 Days
* Contribute to customer implementations and integrations.
* Propose and execute improvements to engineering workflows or developer tooling.
* Gain confidence in guiding AI-generated code and writing appropriate guardrails.

At 120–180 Days
* Take ownership of a product area, reliably shipping features customers use.
* Integrate customer feedback directly into your work.
* Present one internal "retrospective" on what you built, what you learned, and what you'd improve next cycle.

Who You Are
* Senior-level Northeastern student (CS, Computer Engineering, or related field).
* A builder with a track record — personal projects, hackathons, or internships.
* Solid technical foundation across modern web stacks (React, HTML, TypeScript, Go, Python, AWS, etc.).
* Adaptable and eager to learn new technologies quickly.
* Strong product sense: can identify what's worth building, not just how.
* Excited to use AI tools as leverage, not threatened by them.
* Energized by talking to customers and shaping features from their pain points.
* Thrives with support nearby but doesn't need handholding.

Read This Carefully
* 📩 Not a ticket-taker — ☐ you'll decide what to build.
* 📩 Not heads-down-only — ☐ you'll be customer-facing.
* 📩 Not for order-followers — ☐ you'll have support but must set your own direction.

How We Work
* Always part of the solution – We don't stop at identifying problems; we fix them.
* Invent and simplify – We search for ideas everywhere and simplify relentlessly.
* Progress over perfection – We bias toward bold action, learn quickly, and adapt.
* See something, say something – Our wins and misses are collective; transparency is a must.

Software Engineering Co-op
Levo
Boston, MA (In-person)
Co-op

Title: Product Engineer Co-op (6-month)
Location: Boston (in-person; customer exposure expected)

technical_skills: AI coding assistants (e.g., GitHub Copilot, Devin)
soft_skills: Product sense and ability to translate user needs into requirements
Collaboration and teamwork (working with CEO and senior engineers)
Self‑direction and ability to set own direction without hand‑holding
Adaptability and quick learning of new technologies
Problem‑solving and ownership of end‑to‑end features
Ability to propose and lead process improvements
Transparency and willingness to share wins and misses
Bias toward action and rapid iteration
requirements.education: Senior‑level undergraduate student pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field (e.g., Northeastern University).
nice_to_have: Personal projects, hackathons, or prior internships demonstrating a builder mindset
Experience with AI‑generated code and establishing guardrails
Familiarity with healthcare industry workflows or regulations
Experience with product ownership across mock‑up, build, ship, and monitor phases
Knowledge of additional programming languages or frameworks (e.g., Node.js, Ruby, Java)
Experience with agile methodologies and sprint planning

missing_skills: AI coding assistants (e.g., GitHub Copilot, Devin)
Monitoring and observability tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, New Relic)
Explicit product ownership across mock‑up, build, ship, and monitor phases
recommendations: Add "CSS" to the Skills section (even if basic) and mention any styling work done in the VaultDB.ai or other web projects.
If you have any exposure to Go, include it (e.g., personal learning, small scripts, or coursework). If not, consider a brief statement of intent to learn Go quickly.

Highlight any use of AI coding assistants such as GitHub Copilot in your development workflow; a simple bullet like "Leveraged GitHub Copilot to accelerate feature development and maintain code quality" will satisfy that requirement.
Mention any monitoring/observability experience—e.g., using logging frameworks, Prometheus, Grafana, CloudWatch, or even simple health‑check endpoints you built for your embedded or web projects.
Emphasize end‑to‑end product ownership: add a bullet under the VaultDB.ai project describing how you gathered requirements, designed mock‑ups, implemented, deployed, and monitored the service.
Include a brief line about Agile methodology participation (e.g., sprint planning, stand‑ups, retrospectives) to reinforce your fit with the team's process culture.
If you have any exposure to healthcare data or regulations (HIPAA, HL7), add a short note; otherwise, consider a personal project or coursework that touches on data privacy to show awareness.
Quantify impact wherever possible (e.g., "Reduced deployment time by 40%", "Improved testing throughput by X%", "Supported 200‑student class with 100% satisfaction rating").

Add a “Soft Skills” bullet list or integrate keywords such as "strong communication", "product sense", "self‑direction", "bias toward action", and "presentation skills" to align with the job description.
strengths: Outstanding academic performance (4.0 GPA) in a rigorous Computer Science program.
Hands‑on embedded systems experience with C++/Qt and real‑time vehicle control, demonstrating low‑level programming and hardware‑software integration.
Leadership as Head Teaching Assistant, managing a team of 10+ TAs and coordinating support for a 200‑student course.
Full‑stack web development expertise: React + TypeScript front‑end, AWS deployment, Docker containerization, and CI/CD pipelines with GitHub Actions.
Data analysis and visualization experience for major tech clients (Google, Databricks, Amazon), showcasing ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Proven process improvement mindset (replacing hard‑coded settings with configurable files, reducing manual effort).
Strong collaboration across multidisciplinary teams (software, electrical, mechanical) and effective communication of technical concepts to non‑technical stakeholders.
